enWisdom: A noble-minded person rejects disgrace and honours his neighbour
The worst of neighbours is the wicked neighbour

Wisdom: جَاوِرْ مَنْ تَأْمَنُ شَرَّهُ وَلَا يَعْدُوكَ خَيْرُهُ
enWisdom: Be a neighbour to one from whose evil you are safe and whose goodness does not turn away from you

Wisdom: جَارُ السَّوْءِ أَعْظَمُ الضَّرَّاءِ وَأَشَدُّ الْبَلَاءِ
enWisdom: A wicked neighbour is the greatest adversity and the most serious tribulation
Ask about the neighbour before the house

Wisdom: سُوءُ الْجِوَارِ وَالْإِسَاءَةُ إِلَى الْأَبْرَارِ مِنْ أَعْظَمِ اللُّؤْمِ
enWisdom: Being a bad neighbour and offending the virtuous are the worst forms of vileness
One who is neighbourly gets many neighbours

Wisdom: مَنْ أَحْسَنَ إِلَى جِيرَانِهِ كَثُرَ خَدَمُهُ
enWisdom: One who is good to his neighbours gets many helpers

Wisdom: مَنْ تَطَلَّعَ عَلَى [إِلَى‏] أَسْرَارِ جَارِهِ انْهَتَكَتْ [انتهكت‏] أَسْتَارُهُ
enWisdom: One who seeks to learn about the secrets of his neighbour, his [own] curtains [of secrets] are torn apart
Taking care of one’s neighbour is an act of magnanimity
Being a bad neighbour is from the signs of vileness
He whose neighbours are abased is not honoured

Wisdom: نِظَامُ الْفُتُوَّةِ احْتِمَالُ عَثَرَاتِ الْإِخْوَانِ وَحُسْنُ تَعَهُّدِ الْجِيرَانِ
enWisdom: The order of chivalry is being tolerant of the mistakes of one’s brothers and fulfilling one’s obligation towards his neighbours
